program_description: This program helps eligible communities prepare for, or recover from, an emergency that threatens the availability of safe, reliable drinking water.
eligible_area_criteria_1: Rural areas and towns with populations of 10,000 or less, including Tribal lands and colonias in eligible areas.
eligible_area_criteria_2: The area must have a median household income less than the state's median household income for non-metropolitan areas.
funds_use_water_source_grants_descriptio: construct a water source, intake or treatment facility
funds_use_distribution_systems_grants_pu: Repair breaks or leaks in existing water distribution lines
Perform water line maintenance necessary to replenish the water supply
Purchase or maintain water storage tanks
matching_funds_encouraged_partnerships: other federal, state, local, private, and nonprofit entities
questions_contact_source: Your local USDA Rural Development office
governing_law_2_name: Section 306A of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act
note_general_advice: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local USDA Rural Development office for help.
note_usda_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
